title: Whisper Protocol: How could I use already generated keyPair or symKey after geth is restarted? Key pair cannot be stored //Error: non-existent key ID
body:
- Geth version:
```
Geth
Version: 1.8.0-unstable
Git Commit: e7610eadfee686d7d979e8d23d0b903a78288a13
Architecture: amd64
Protocol Versions: [63 62]
Network Id: 1
Go Version: go1.8
Operating System: linux
GOPATH=
GOROOT=/usr/local/go
```

- OS & Version: Linux

-------------------------

My goal is to send a message from one ethereum node to another one by using same public key of the receiver. In order to accomplish it, I have followed this [guide][1] that uses Whisper Protocol. But after `geth` on receiver is restarted its `keyPair` is lost and it says `Error: invalid id` for it when I tried to use it again.

- Please note that [Whisper Protocol Overview][2] is out of date and `shh.newIdentity()` function does not exists anymore. 


In summary approach I followed from the linked answer above that successfully works within the `geth` session:

***On the receiver node:***

    > kId = web3.shh.newKeyPair(); //"d4a2504d22955f20156c75bfce5c7f273865f7d8976de5eed3a48a103e4e6d2d"
    > web3.shh.hasKeyPair(kId) //true
    > web3.shh.newMessageFilter(
        {privateKeyID:kId}, 
        function(err, res) {console.log(web3.toUtf8(res.payload))});
    > web3.shh.getPublicKey(kId) //returns PUBLIC_KEY_OF_THE_RECEIVER

    > stored_kId = web3.shh.addPrivateKey(shh.getPrivateKey(kId)); //"b8a8344ae7010b8453e47c31d5cb99edbc7adce5ae3fe8ece2ee90dd0bcf446c"    
    > web3.shh.hasKeyPair(stored_kId) //true   

***On the sender node:***

    web3.shh.post({
      pubKey: 'PUBLIC_KEY_OF_THE_RECEIVER',
      ttl: 7,
      topic: '0x07678231',
      powTarget: 2.01,
      powTime: 2,
      payload: web3.fromAscii("Hello there!")
      });

--------------

The problem I am facing is when I restart the `geth` on the receiver node; I cannot reuse the `kId(web3.shh.newKeyPair())` that is already created on the receiver before `geth` is restarted. So I need to regenerate `shh.newKeyPair()` and share its public key with the sender all over again (which seems inefficient).

The error I am receiving after `geth` is restarted.

    > kId ="d4a2504d22955f20156c75bfce5c7f273865f7d8976de5eed3a48a103e4e6d2d" //web3.shh.newKeyPair() that is created before geth is restarted.
    > web3.shh.getPublicKey(kId)
    Error: invalid id
    > web3.shh.hasKeyPair(kId) //false

So I have to create `newKeyPair()` all over again and share its public key with the sender. 

- This creates additional issue where, if receiver's `geth` node is restarted, sender's messages will not be received on receiver's end and sender will need to resent those messages into receiver with receiver's newly created public key all over again.

------------

Please note that I observe similar issue on `newSymKey()`. 

**Example:** 

    > shh.newSymKey()
    "2d97351f0c7394679c70472b9b3a2abf3a22b6cdc9815574b103b92e1f1bfde1"
    > shh.getSymKey("2d97351f0c7394679c70472b9b3a2abf3a22b6cdc9815574b103b92e1f1bfde1")
    "0x1edddb4ec019ce0f31e8a4a381c9b436476b547317d9508ce9dac1fb146a65f0"

restart the geth node and I tried to `getSymKey()`. with already generated `symKey`:

    > shh.getSymKey("2d97351f0c7394679c70472b9b3a2abf3a22b6cdc9815574b103b92e1f1bfde1")
    Error: non-existent key ID

**More depth analysis:**

From: [Whisper v5 RPC API][3] 

>     shh_addPrivateKey
>     
>     Stores the key pair, and returns its ID.
>     
>     Parameters
>     
>     String: private key as HEX bytes.
>     Returns
>     
>     String: Key ID on success and an error on failure.

I have also tried `shh_addPrivateKey` to store the key pair. But after `geth` is restarted it seems like store key pair also lost and I cannot restore it.

Following line is used as the last line on the receiver node.

    > shh.addPrivateKey(shh.getPrivateKey(kId))
    "b8a8344ae7010b8453e47c31d5cb99edbc7adce5ae3fe8ece2ee90dd0bcf446c"

After geth is restarted still I cannot restore the keys with already added private-key's `Key ID`:

    > kId='b8a8344ae7010b8453e47c31d5cb99edbc7adce5ae3fe8ece2ee90dd0bcf446c'
    > shh.getPublicKey(kId)
    Error: invalid id
    > web3.shh.hasKeyPair(kId) //false

**[Q]** How could I handle this issue, where restoring already generated key pair (`shh.newKeyPair()` or `shh.newSymKey()`) after `geth` is restarted?


  [1]: https://ethereum.stackexchange.com/q/51604/4575
  [2]: http://github.com/ethereum/wiki/wiki/Whisper-Overview
  [3]: https://github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/wiki/Whisper-v5-RPC-API#shh_addprivatekey

Finally I was able to solve it.

After `geth` is restarted we need to call `shh.addPrivateKey()`. I guess `add` is meant for load the key pair. I was confused that I thought `shh.addPrivateKey()` was meant for save the key pairs.

    > kId = web3.shh.newKeyPair() //create new key-pair
      "dcc9b5c6cc7110e118b45e5c6bec9b5755a02da6e57cb62a9ac1ce57e0aac41b"
    > shh.getPrivateKey(kId) //Store this, it will be used on geth's new session
      "0x41a31ffc64eab3a672c408f77a82895d63623e6ccb1d08b5859f72fd6eb2e0fb"
    > shh.getPublicKey(kId);   
      "0x04ed41f7ce2a44264224c34d6f2b1f9fdf00dbdb812d1e7174aec9835e80b72dc8a75113a359a8abdccac518a389c8756bb285563cb73d45abb3723c3c9c5392bc"
    > web3.shh.hasKeyPair(kId) //true
    > web3.shh.newMessageFilter(
        {privateKeyID:kId}, 
        function(err, res) {console.log(web3.toUtf8(res.payload))});

After `geth` restarted call `shh.addPrivateKey()` function with argument previously(before `geth` was closed) created key pair's private key:

**On Reciever:**

    > privateKey = '0x41a31ffc64eab3a672c408f77a82895d63623e6ccb1d08b5859f72fd6eb2e0fb'; //From previous geth session
    > kId=shh.addPrivateKey(privateKey) //Loads the key-pair
      "5c987a5999f3214f34c778a390e338583dd7a3b2837967158bf55af2306ea641"
    > shh.hasKeyPair(kId); //true
    > shh.getPublicKey(kId); //Same public key is received that is also obtained before geth is closed. 
     "0x04ed41f7ce2a44264224c34d6f2b1f9fdf00dbdb812d1e7174aec9835e80b72dc8a75113a359a8abdccac518a389c8756bb285563cb73d45abb3723c3c9c5392bc"
    > web3.shh.newMessageFilter(
            {privateKeyID:kId}, 
            function(err, res) {console.log(web3.toUtf8(res.payload))});

**On Sender:**

    web3.shh.post({
      pubKey: '0x04ed41f7ce2a44264224c34d6f2b1f9fdf00dbdb812d1e7174aec9835e80b72dc8a75113a359a8abdccac518a389c8756bb285563cb73d45abb3723c3c9c5392bc',
      ttl: 7,
      topic: '0x07678231',
      powTarget: 2.01,
      powTime: 2,
      payload: web3.fromAscii("Hello there!")
      });

----------

- Please note that I am still working on have to retrieve messages that are sent when `geth` was closed.

Were you actually able to send and receive messages from two different nodes? 

I was able to send/receive from the same node, but not from two different ones.
@alemhnan: Yes I was trying to solve that issue as well. Please my answer about this.: https://ethereum.stackexchange.com/a/58299/4575

I've just tried the same and I do not get any message.

I'm using this command to run `geth`:
```bash
geth --syncmode "light" --shh --rpc --rpcaddr "0.0.0.0" --rpcapi "eth,net,web3,admin,shh" --rpccorsdomain "*" --ws --wsaddr "0.0.0.0" --wsapi "eth,net,web3,admin,shh" --wsorigins "*"
```

I've tried also using ropsten but still not working.
I'm able to see the messages printed if I run the scripts in the same machine. 
I'm now trying in two different computers with two independent nodes (one hotspot with mobile and one home router).

With that configuration there is no way to get the messages. I've tried also using the geth commands, the nodejs package and also now your python code. Same result (so actually no results).

Is there something very silly that I'm missing?

@alemhnan : Let's continue from this issue [Whisper: Posted messages won't filtered on the other nodes](https://github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/issues/17545). I have tried again, but it does not work on my end as well :(

I also re-opened the [question](https://ethereum.stackexchange.com/questions/57693/whisper-how-to-send-a-message-from-one-node-to-another-that-is-located-on-diff) I have asked on ethereum-stackexchange related to this manner. Hope it will find an answer.
